tags.name: v1.0.0
tags.body: Go mod

tags.name: v2.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #65 from SimonRichardson/charm-dependencies

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/65

As the charm brings in dependency breaking changes (prefix for bundles are required), this ensures that all consumers of this library are fully exposed to the fact that the underlying charm and charmrepo changes are breaking changes and I’m forcing bundlechanges users to understand this.

The number of changes inside go mod and sum are a bit concerning, but all the tests pass, so I’m inclined to leave it as-is for now.

tags.name: v1.0.0
tags.body:
Merge pull request #64 from SimonRichardson/deterministic-master

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/64

The following ensure that the applications that we loop through are deterministic, so that when adding application units we skip correctly with in the loop.

This is fixing LP #1883645

releases.title: v1.0.1
releases.body:
What’s Changed

This is a small bugfix update from previous versions, though there is one small behavioral change.

The primary fix is that previously if you did ExpBackoff(min=1.0, max=200, factor=2.0, jitter=false), then the times would be in the expected 1.0, 2.0, 4.0. Up to the max. However, when you set jitter=true, while it would preserve the maximum to be the same time as the original backoff, it would pick a random value from 0ms to the max delay, and then truncate that to the minDelay. Which meant that it actually changed the average wait time to something close to 50% of the expected times.

The new logic does a +/- 20% from the expected delay, and then caps that at min and max. This averages very close to the expected values (in testing, the over time difference is around a 1% shift.)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/retry/compare/v1.0.0…v1.0.1## What’s Changed * fix: cleanup our handling of jitter and other misc by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/retry/pull/12

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Fix publish-term command with zero revision. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/8
  • Update dependencies, switch from launchpad.net/gnuflags to juju/gnufl… by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/12
  • Add –content switch to just show the term content text. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/11
  • List-terms command. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/14
  • Remove plugin wrapper. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/17
  • cmd/list_terms: Minor docs and command rename by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/18
  • Common command base; support no-browser login, browser by default. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/19
  • Added context to all methods by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/20
  • Update README.md by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/21
  • Update code to use bakery.v2 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/22
  • Bump juju/errors version by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/23
  • Enable juju-bot for this repo by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/24
  • update dependencies by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/25
  • Use github.com/go-macaroon-bakery/macaroon-bakery/v3 instead of the gopkg.in v2 version by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/26
  • Use gopkg.in/macaroon-bakery.v3 instead of github.com/go-macaroon-bakery/macaroon-bakery/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/27
  • Use bakery v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/28
  • Remove import of the entire juju/juju repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/29
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/30

New Contributors

  • @tasdomas made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/12
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/22
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/23
  • @mhilton made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terms-client/pull/25

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/terms-client/compare/v1.0.1…v2.0.0

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162
  • Update to use utils/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/163
  • Upstream dep updates by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/164

New Contributors

  • @natefinch made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • @babbageclunk made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • @kat-co made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • @reedobrien made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • @alesstimec made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • @macgreagoir made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • @mjs made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • @anastasiamac made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • @ycliuhw made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • @achilleasa made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/testing/commits/v1.0.0

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.title: juju-restore v0.12
releases.body: Add a new --copy-controller option to initialise a new controller to look like a backed up controller. This is useful when setting up a controller for a newer Juju version and copying to that new controller users, clouds, and config from an existing controller. See #23.

releases.title: Ops 2.21.1, ops-tracing 2.21.1 and ops-scenario 7.21.1 reverting fresh charm instance for deferred events
releases.body:
What’s Changed

This hot-fix release reverts the 2.21.0 change where separate charm class instances were used to run deferred events. That change was not compatible with a certain charming practice where custom upgrade code is run before event processing. We’re reverting for now and will discuss with the charming teams what the way forward may be.

Reverted

  • Reverting “run deferred events with fresh charm instances” in #1711

Documentation

  • Add best practices about status in #1689

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.21.0…2.21.1

releases.title: Ops 2.21.0, ops-tracing 2.21.0 and ops-scenario 7.21.0 Native tracing support in ops and support for Pebble identities
releases.body:
What’s Changed

This release adds ops[tracing], the first-party tracing support for your charms, support for reading and setting Pebble identities and a change where a new instance of the charm class is used for each deferred event.

Potential gotchas

Due to https://github.com/canonical/charmcraft/issues/2259, your charm may not build against 20.04 base, if you are using requirements.txt or other mechanism that enforces building all dependencies from source. Please wait for charmcraft 3.4 hot fix or migrate to the uv plugin. The issue is not unique to ops, however this release brings in a new dependency that is affected. If yours is a simple charm without complex charm libs, you may be able work around the issue by restricting your dependencies, like ops <= 2.20.0.

Each deferred event is now run in a fresh instance of your charm class. The change should be safe for most charms, however, if your charm defers events and shares data between the deferred event and the current event in the charm class, please test thoroughly. The Ops pre-commit and commit events are also now emitted after each deferred event, so if you use those and defer, please check that it’s safe to have them run more than once per hook.

Features

  • Opstracing in #1612
  • Pebble identities in #1672
  • Run deferred events with fresh charm instances in #1631

Fixes

  • Allow TLS 1.2 in ops-tracing in #1705
  • Try to fix flaky pebble exec test in #1664

Documentation

  • Add best practice note around using tooling provided by the charmcraft profile in #1700
  • Clarify guidance about designing python modules in #1670
  • Fix a bug in the k8s tutorial doc about unit test in #1688
  • Fix broken link in readme in #1679
  • Fix links to juju docs in #1681
  • Fix tox command in hacking.md in #1661
  • Improve landing page of kubernetes charm tutorial in #1660

CI

  • Add zizmor to static check github workflows in #1656
  • Change prerelease setting used to add latest ops and the testing API in #1682
  • Don’t pin release jobs to github environments in #1683
  • Don’t run tests within the publish job in #1684
  • Fix smoke test in #1698
  • Post-release versioning, release process update + workflow fix in #1658
  • Rename “tox -e fmt” to “tox -e format” in #1668

Tests

  • Fix overly specific test that fails sometimes with tracing in #1695

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.20.0…2.21.0

releases.title: ops 2.20.0 and ops-scenario 7.20.0 remove_revision, remote_model, config metadata, custom events in testing, pebble layer merging fixes in testing, and docs improvements
releases.body:
What’s Changed

This release of ops features a new remove_revision() convenience method to avoid working directly with revision numbers in secret-remove and secret-expired events. A new remote_model property has been added for Relation. The efficiency of RelationData.Content.update has also been improved, and the config metadata is now exposed in CharmMeta.

This ops-scenario release features the ability to emit custom events, as well as additional data verification and stronger immutability. Additionally, Pebble layer merging has been fixed, both in this package and in Harness.

Our documentation continues to improve. We migrated best practices from the Juju docs and made the Kubernetes charm tutorial shorter and more focused. We also reorganised the testing docs into a single how-to guide about unit testing and a more accessible explanation about testing in general.

Features

  • Add a remove_revision() method to SecretRemoveEvent and SecretExpiredEvent in #1624
  • Add Relation.remote_model property in #1610
  • Efficient implementation of RelationDataContent.update in #1586
  • Expose the config metadata in CharmMeta in #1648
  • Add the ability to emit custom events in unit tests in #1589
  • Check that the check-infos in testing.Container match the plan in #1630
  • ops.testing.State components are less mutable in #1617

Fixes

  • Assorted fixes for Pebble layer merging in Harness and Scenario in #1627

Documentation

  • Add a docs link to the Harness deprecation warning in #1513
  • Add best practices and a “manage charms” how-to in #1615
  • Add section about services with long startup time in #1604
  • Clarify how to use mounts in ops.testing.Container in #1637
  • Fix code snippet indentation in #1649
  • Fix Scenario example in #1616
  • Move hooks-based charm migration guide in #1636
  • Putting test into each chapter of the tutorial in #1647
  • Refactor how-to unit test according to comments in #1642
  • Refactor test docs to 1 explanation and 2 how-tos in #1628
  • Remove the charm-tech@lists.launchpad.net email address in #1632
  • Remove tutorial chapters that are covered by the how-to guide in #1511
  • Stack args vertically for long signature lines in #1641
  • Testing explanation in #1635
  • Unify charm test docs how to in #1639

CI

  • Exclude vault-k8s-operator until the system can handle monorepos in #1650
  • Use the latest version of ops-scenario in the compatibility tests in #1608

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.19.2…2.20.0

releases.title: v1.0.0: some breaking changes, add all_agents_idle, deploy bind, temp_model controller
releases.body:
This is the first 1.x release of Jubilant. It includes two minor breaking changes, but we’ll do our best to ensure there are no breaking changes to the API after this release.

The breaking changes are:

  • In config() and model_config(), make reset an explicit arg instead of using None values in the dict #125
  • In offer(), make endpoint a keyword-only arg instead of using *args #126

Non-breaking features are:

  • Add jubilant.all_agents_idle helper #127
  • In deploy(), add bind argument #121
  • Allow temp_model to specify a controller #124 (contributed by @MichaelThamm)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/jubilant/compare/v0.5.0…v1.0.0

releases.title: v0.5.0: all_*/any_* now use *args; status-error fix; add_secret, model_config, scp
releases.body:
This release adds the Juju.scp method (#109), the Juju.model_config method (#115), and the Juju.add_secret method (#112).

There are two breaking changes since v0.4.1:

  1. This one may affect you: we changed all_* and any_* to take *apps instead of a list (#116). If you’re using helpers like jubilant.all_active and passing a list of apps, you’ll need to change jubilant.all_active(status, ['app1', 'app2']) to jubilant.all_active(status, 'app1', 'app2') – in other words, drop the brackets.

  2. This one probably won’t require any changes: instead of raising an exception when parsing a Juju status object with “status-error” values, we now return a special “failed” status (#120). This will prevent integration tests failing when Juju is setting up machines (and similar cases). Thanks @imanenami for the report in #118.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/jubilant/compare/v0.4.1…v0.5.0

releases.title: v1.21.0: http-address in /v1/system-info
releases.body:
This release adds the http-address to the /v1/system-info API, as well as several small fixes and doc improvements:

  • feat: add http-address to /v1/system-info in #606
  • fix: tighten permissions of –create-dirs directory from 0o755 to 0o700 in #600
  • docs: document how to tail file logs in #598

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.20.0…v1.21.0

releases.title: v1.20.0: PEBBLE_VERBOSE, pebble check --refresh, Go 1.24
releases.body:
This release adds several new features:

  • PEBBLE_VERBOSE to enable pebble run or pebble enter’s verbose mode with an environment variable instead of only the command-line option. This is equivalent to --verbose, but for when you don’t have the ability to modify the command line. #576
  • The pebble check command, with a --refresh option to run a health check immediately. This is useful for diagnosing an individual check. #574 and #577
  • A new plan section called workloads, primarily for projects that import Pebble. #571

The release also fixes a panic in HTTP-based health checks with invalid URLs (#580), and adds several documentation and testing improvements.

This release also updates the Go version to Go 1.24 now that 1.22 is end-of-life. #585

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.19.0…v1.20.0

releases.title: v1.19.0: metrics endpoint, basic auth, start/stop checks
releases.body:
This is a minor release with some useful new features:

  • A startup field for checks, and the ability to start and stop checks (#560)
  • A new basic type identity for Basic HTTP authentication (#563)
  • A metrics endpoint at /v1/metrics in OpenMetrics/Prometheus format, providing metrics for services and checks (#519)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.18.0…v1.19.0

releases.title: pathops-v0.0.0
releases.body:
This is the first non-pre-release version of charmlibs-pathops. The development status is now beta. Ownership and permission behaviour has been made consistent, and file removal methods have been added.

What’s Changed

  • docs: add Python packages how-to by @james-garner-canonical in #36
  • docs: correct the description of the default permissions for directories by @james-garner-canonical in #41
  • docs: better examples and ordering for ContainerPath constructor by @james-garner-canonical in #42
  • docs: remove bad whitespace by @james-garner-canonical in #44
  • tests: validate that Pebble and LocalPath.mkdir behaviour aligns by @james-garner-canonical in #45
  • feat: LocalPath also sets group (if not specified) based on user by @james-garner-canonical in #38
  • fix: Fileinfo.{user,group} are typed optional but should always be there by @james-garner-canonical in #43
  • fix: write methods no longer change existing mode unless it’s passed explicitly by @james-garner-canonical in #47
  • fix: consistent behaviour for mkdir chown args when exists by @james-garner-canonical in #48
  • docs: use juju 3.6 for intersphinx since latest is now private by @james-garner-canonical in #51
  • feat: add ContainerPath.rmdir and unlink methods by @james-garner-canonical in #52
  • chore: bump version and development status for beta release by @james-garner-canonical in #53

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmtech-charmlibs/compare/pathops-v0.0.0a1…pathops-v0.0.0

commits.author: Andrew Scribner
commits.message:
fix: handle case where get_deployed_resources is called on a resource_type not in cluster (#3)

During teardown, especially when destroying a model, we can have a race condition where resource_type’s owner may have already been deleted and thus the resource_type CRD has been removed. For that reason, ignore 404 errors here and just proceed to the next resource.

commits.author: Dragomir Penev
commits.message: Update relative path charmcraft and metadata YAMLs (#37)

commits.author: Carl Csaposs
commits.message:
Run renovate once per week (#36)

for vulnerability updates to get a PR immediately (instead of once a week), these steps must be followed: https://docs.renovatebot.com/configuration-options/#vulnerabilityalerts

notably: - on forks and private repos, the dependency graph needs to be enabled: https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/understanding-your-software-supply-chain/about-the-dependency-graph#enabling-the-dependency-graph - on all repos, Dependabot alerts need to be enabled: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/managing-your-repositorys-settings-and-features/enabling-features-for-your-repository/managing-security-and-analysis-settings-for-your-repository - the GitHub Renovate app must be installed with read permissions for dependabot alerts

from testing, it appears the removal of support for python 3.8 only applies to “Dependabot security updates”, not “Dependabot alerts” the closing of this issue (https://github.com/dependabot/dependabot-core/issues/10817) happening on the same day day as this blog post (https://github.blog/changelog/2025-01-06-closing-down-notice-dependabot-will-no-longer-support-python-version-3-8/) appears to confirm that it applies to “Dependabot security updates”

releases.title: 3/stable 24.12 Release
releases.body:
Charmed Apache Kafka bundle

New features and bug fixes in the Charmed Apache Kafka bundle:

Features

  • [DPE-2285] Refer to Charmhub space from GitHub (#200)
  • [DPE-3333] Add integration test for broken tls (#188)
  • [DPE-3721] chore: use tools-log4j.properties for run_bin_command (#201)
  • [DPE-3735] Integration of custom alerting rules and dashboards (#180)
  • [DPE-3780] Set workload version in install hook (#182)
  • [DPE-3857] Test consistency between workload and metadata versions (#186)
  • [DPE-3926] Enforce zookeeper client interface (#196)
  • [DPE-3928] feat: secrets integration (#189)
  • [DPE-5702] chore: Active Controllers alert set to == 0 (#252)
  • [CSS-6503] Add OAuth support for non-charmed external clients (#168)
  • [DPE-5757] Add extra-listeners config option (#269)

Bug fixes

  • [DPE-3880] Remove instance field from grafana dashboard (#191)
  • [DPE-3880] Remove all instances of $job variable in dashboard (#181)
  • [DPE-3900] Remove APT references (#183)
  • [DPE-3932] Fix illegal character on matrix channel (#187)
  • [DPE-4133] Do not change permissions on existing folders when reusing storage (#195)
  • [DPE-4362] fix: alive, restart and alive handling (#202)
  • [DPE-5757] fix: ensure certs are refreshed on SANs DNS changes (#276)

Other changes

  • [MISC] Test on juju 3.4 (#190)
  • [MISC] Update package dependencies
  • [DPE-3588] Release documentation update (#175)
  • [MISC] CI improvements (#209)
  • [DPE-3214] Release 3.6.1 (#179)
  • [DPE-5565] Upgrade dataplatform libs to v38
  • [discourse-gatekeeper] Migrate charm docs (#210, #203, #198, #194, #192)
  • [DPE-3932] Update information in metadata.yaml

Charmed Apache ZooKeeper bundle

New features and bug fixes in the Charmed Apache ZooKeeper bundle:

Features

  • [DPE-2285] Refer to Charmhub space from GitHub (#143)
  • [DPE-2597] Re use existing storage (#138)
  • [DPE-3737] Implement ZK client interface (#142)
  • [DPE-3782] Set workload version in install and config hooks (#130)
  • [DPE-3857] Test consistency between workload and metadata versions (#136)
  • [DPE-3869] Secrets in ZK (#129)
  • [DPE-5626] chore: update ZooKeeper up alerting (#166)

Bug fixes

  • [DPE-3880] Remove job variable from dashboard (#134)
  • [DPE-3900] Remove APT references (#131)
  • [DPE-3932] Fix illegal character on matrix channel (#133, #135)
  • [DPE-4183] fix: only handle quorum removal on relation-departed (#146)
  • [DPE-4362] fix: alive, restart and alive handling (#145)

Other changes

  • [DPE-5565] Stable release upgrade
  • chore: bump dp_libs ver (#147)
  • [MISC] General update dependencies (#144)
  • [MISC] Update CI to Juju 3.4 (#137)
  • [DPE-3932] Update information in metadata.yaml
  • [MISC] Update cryptography to 42.0.5

Canonical Data issues are now public on both Jira and GitHub platforms.

Inside the charms

Contents of the Charmed Apache Kafka and Charmed Apache ZooKeeper include:

  • Charmed Apache ZooKeeper is based on the charmed-zookeeper snap of the 3/stable channel (Ubuntu LTS “22.04” - core22-based) that ships the Apache ZooKeeper 3.8.4-ubuntu0, built and supported by Canonical
  • Charmed Apache Kafka is based on the charmed-kafka snap of the 3/stable channel (Ubuntu LTS “22.04” - core22-based) that ships the Apache Kafka 3.6.1-ubuntu0, built and supported by Canonical
  • Principal charms support the latest LTS series “22.04” only.

More information about the artifacts are provided by the following table:

Artifact Track/Series Version/Revision Code
Apache ZooKeeper distribution 3.x 3.8.4-ubuntu0 78499c
Apache Kafka distribution 3.x 3.6.1-ubuntu0 db44db
Charmed Apache ZooKeeper snap 3/stable 34 13f3c6
Charmed Apache ZooKeeper operator 3/stable 149 40576c
Charmed Apache Kafka snap 3/stable 37 c266f9
Charmed Apache Kafka operator 3/stable 195 7948df

Technical notes

  • GitHub Releases provide a detailed list of bugfixes, PRs, and commits for each revision.
  • Upgrades from previous stable versions can be done with the standard upgrading process, as outlined in the documentation
